ad_text: Holland, L.P. Sponsored Job Description JOB SUMMARY: To assist in delivery of Coal, Coke & Limestone to American Crystal Sugar Co & additional customers using end dump, belly dump, or live bottom trailers. May also be required to operate track mobile, and aid in stacking operations at the unload site, and equipment transportation on lowboy trailers. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS may include but not limited to: • Visually inspect truck & trailer for safe operations. • Maintain all DOT required logs and vehicle inspection records. • Follow all Holland, L.P. & American Crystal Sugar safety rules on site, and at all factories. • Must meet delivery time requirements for route that is assigned to you. • Keep coal free of contaminates and deliver to coal storage bunker or stockpile at customer. • Other duties as assigned PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: • Standing, walking, bending, and stretching are required to perform the job safely and successfully. • Manual dexterity to handle tools, hammers, and the ability to move 25 pounds are regularly required. • Vision must be sufficient for driving, and inspection of trucks and all other equipment required for the purpose of material handling. ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS: • Exposure on a regular basis to outdoor weather conditions. • Exposure to Coal dust from coal unloading, stacking operations, truck loading & unloading. • Exposure to silica dust from limestone unloading. • Exposure to gasoline & fuel vapors when fueling trucks and equipment. QUALIFICATIONS: • Must be at least 18 years of age. • Minimum of 1 year of Truck driving experience preferred. • Positive attitude & strong work ethic. • Demonstrated math, reading, and writing skills to read car ID numbers, and prepare reports. • Satisfactory completion of all company-training program for Driver/Operators. • Ability to successfully complete all pre-employment testing required by Holland, L.P. • Maintain valid Class A CDL and abide by our Corporate Fleet Policy FULL-TIME · ARDOCH, NORTH DAKOTA $1500 SIGN ON BONUS- NIGHT SHIFT TRUCK DRIVERS NEEDED Apply now

Holland, L.P. Sponsored Responsible for scheduled maintenance and break down repairs of all equipment employed in the operation of material handling, including trucks, trailers, wheel loaders, skid steer loaders, backhoes, track mobile, dozers, motor graders, unload conveyors, stacking conveyors, coal conditioners and pickups. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS include but not limited to: • Providing troubleshooting and technical assistance to operating personnel on all tool and equipment issues. • Track & perform all scheduled maintenance for all equipment used in the unloading of rail cars. • Keep all equipment operating properly, making repairs as needed. • Perform annual equipment inspections and document for DOT requirements. • Keep shop area clean and free from hazards and practice all shop safety procedures. • Other duties as assigned PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: • Standing, walking, bending, and stretching are required to perform equipment maintenance operations. • Manual dexterity to handle tools, hammers, and the ability to move 25 pounds are required to perform vehicle and equipment maintenance operations. • Vision must be sufficient for driving, and inspection and repair of trucks, and all other equipment required for material handling. ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS: • Working in shop standing on concrete, and climbing over equipment. • Exposure on a occasional basis to outdoor weather conditions. • Exposure to coal dust from coal unloading operations, gasoline and fuel vapor while servicing trucks and equipment. • Exposure to silica dust from unloading limestone. • Contact with solvents and sealants necessary for equipment repair. QUALIFICATIONS: • High School Diploma or GED; some technical schooling preferred • Minimum 2 years’ experience with basic car and/or truck repairs such as oil changes, tire rotations, etc… required • Experience in heavy truck and equipment repairs preferred • Must have own hand tools, specialty tools will be provided. • Positive attitude & strong work ethic • Demonstrated math, reading, and writing skills to read service manuals, order parts, update and maintain vehicle service records on site. • Satisfactory completion of a company-training program for equipment operators & laborers. • Maintain a valid Driver’s License and abide by our Corporate Fleet Policy; CDL preferred • Ability to successfully complete all pre-employment testing required by Holland, L.P. FULL-TIME · ARDOCH, NORTH DAKOTA $1500 SIGN ON BONUS- MAINTENANCE MECHANIC Apply now

Holland, L.P. Sponsored JOB SUMMARY: Holland Company is seeking a General Laborer for our Ardoch, ND facilities. The General Laborer will be responsible for assisting in unload of Coal, Coke and Limestone to American Crystal Sugar Co. & additional customers. May also be required to operate track mobile, scissor lift truck, and aid in stacking operations at the unload site. They will also assist in all phases of material handling, including door operations, and mobile equipment operations. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS may include but not limited to: • Visually inspect equipment and/or truck and trailer for safe operation • Operate vehicles, track mobile, screen plants, unload conveyors, radial stacker, skid steer & stationary equipment • Aid in all site clean-up and site maintenance • Maintain all required logs and Equipment inspection records • Follow all M-Bar-D & American Crystal Sugar safety rules on site, and at all factories • Keep coal / limestone / coke free of contaminates for delivery to coal storage bunker or stockpile at customer • Continually watch for moving equipment and hazards that could harm you or any other co-worker. Safety is job priority one. • Other duties as assigned PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: • Audio & visual acuity • Ability to walk on uneven surfaces • Ability to climb in and out of various equipment • Heavy work, lifting up to 25 pounds occasionally • Stoop / bend / kneel / crouch / balance / climb on an occasional basis • Wear protective equipment such as hard hat, hearing protection, safety-toe boots, and safety glasses ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS: • Exposure on a regular basis to outdoor weather conditions • Exposure to coal dust from coal unloading, stacking operations, truck unloading • Exposure to silica dust from limestone unloading • Exposure to gasoline and fuel vapors when fueling trucks and equipment • Demonstrated math, reading, and writing skills +QUALIFICATIONS: • Must be at least 18 years of age • Valid Driver’s License Preferred • Ability to work in a high dust environment with PPE • Positive attitude and strong work ethic • Demonstrated math, reading, and writing skills • Ability to successfully complete all pre-employment testing required by Holland L.P. FULL-TIME · ARDOCH, NORTH DAKOTA $1500 SIGN ON BONUS- GENERAL LABORER Apply now

Holland, L.P. Sponsored Job Description Maintain and operate the TrackSTAR vehicle in a safe and efficient manner on track and on hi-way system’s, while displaying a high quality and professional image to all Holland customers. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS may include but not limited to: • Operate TrackSTAR vehicle on roadway (must be willing to obtain a CDL within 6 months) and on rail; follow/meet DOT and railway safety rules & regulations. • Interface with railroad customers and record, document and communicate daily safety briefings & track & time instructions. • Ability to perform preventative maintence inspections (PM’s), troubleshoot and and perform emergency repairs on mechanical, hydraulic, and electrical components and document all PM’s and repairs in CMMS system. • Recognize track events such as switches, bridges, crossings, mileposts, etc. • Ability to understand track geometry testing/defects including defect verification in track. • Learn to calibrate and operate on-board TrackSTAR computer systems. • Ability to read drawings and schematics. • Ability to calibrate hand tools and record in CMMS system • Assist shop, TS maintenance team during maintence PM’s & downtime of STAR units. • Other duties as assigned PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: • Able to walk on uneven ground. • Able to lift up to 50 lbs regularly. • Able to work in confined spaces under and around equipment. • Able to work varying shifts. • Ability to climb a steep ladder frequently. • Ability to travel via ground, air and rail up to 100% ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS: • Exposure on a regular basis to outdoor weather conditions. • Exposure to grease and dirt conditions. • Exposure to extreme weather conditions. • Exposure to railroad operating conditions (PPE Required). QUALIFICATIONS: • High School Diploma or equivalent • Some computer skills helpful. • Good math skills and ability to read and work with graphs. • Intermediate mechanical skills. • Willingness to travel extensively. • Detail oriented. • Excellent communication skills (written & verbal). • Excellent customer relation skills. • Must have good organizational and paperwork skills. • Must possess or be able to secure an AZ or DZ license and abide by our Corporate Fleet Policy • Ability to successfully complete all pre-employment testing required by Holland L.P. FULL-TIME · CRETE, ILLINOIS Track Testing Operator Apply now
